moves.1. d4: Black slips slowly into an inferior position and then a serious blunder leads to resignation.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 d6 3. Nc3 e5 4. e3 Nbd7: An old Indian move order; now black must choose between Be7 or transposition to a KID with g6.
moves.5. Nf3 g6: Black chooses the KID but this leaves the d6 square and diagonal weaker.
moves.6. Be2 Bg7: The GK computer gives white a decent advantage +.66 at this point.
moves.7. dxe5: White looks for an open d file.
moves.7... dxe5 8. e4 O-O 9. Qc2 c6: Blocks nd5 but weakens d6. GK computer shows white with a +.74 advantage now.
moves.10. O-O Qc7 11. Rd1 Re8 12. h3 Nf8: Looking to go to e6 but...
moves.13. Be3: The h3 has made this possible.
moves.13... Ne6 14. c5: A fine move exploring space advantage and pressure on d file.
moves.16. Rd6: A strong move ensuring white has a notable advantage.
moves.18... Bxd6: Only justification for last move but not good enough.
moves.20. Nf3: White has an overwhelming advantage--1.75 according to GK computer. Black resigns.Gk analysis here: http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=21570187&fb=1&rnd=0.4952603350393474
